title: Scarlett Moffatt's ex Lee Wilkinson claims relationship was 'too intense'
text:
He was branded a 'sociopath' by his ex-girlfriend Scarlett Moffatt after the former couple split for the second time in July last year.

Yet Lee Wilkinson seems to be trying his luck at love again, judging by his upcoming appearance on ITV dating show Take Me Out following his break-up from the star.

During a clip from the show, Lee revealed that he is 'looking for his new queen of the jungle', as he referenced his ex's stint on I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here.

Take Me Out! Lee Wilkinson appears to be trying his luck at love again judging by his upcoming appearance on ITV dating show Take Me Out following his break-up from Scarlett Moffatt

Speaking on a pre-recorded tape on the show, Lee said: 'I've always done well with girls, my last girlfriend was pretty well known, former queen of the jungle Scarlett Moffatt.

Lee confessed that their relationship didn't end on particularly good terms and claimed that he felt it was a bit 'too intense' after a short period of time.

He said: 'We were together six months but it all got a bit too intense too quickly. Although it didn't end well we are still friends. So come on girls, who wants to be my new queen of the jungle!'

While trying to land a new romance, Lee attempted to entice a new partner by revealing he has an identical twin brother called Ryan.

He said: 'Ladies if you go on a date with me you might end up seeing double. I've got an identical twin brother and we do everything together.

Ryan and I our super competitive and I'm always trying to lift heavier than him in the gym. Lee then made a further bid for female attention by going shirtless and asking Ryan how he was looking before making his pecks dance.

In May, Scarlett labelled her ex-boyfriend a 'sociopath' and hinted that her family never liked him as she continued to heap praise on her new man, whilst chatting on the red carpet at the TV BAFTAs.

Speaking about Scott, the Gogglebox star turned presenter told The Sun: said: 'My family like him which is a first and it's nice not to be with someone who is a sociopath. I'm loving life.'

Scarlett has been dating police constable Scott since the end of last year, after meeting through a mutual friend in her hometown of Durham.

The television star previously dated hairdresser Luke Crodden for 18 months on-and-off.

The Geordie star previously admitted she falls for 'pathological liars' and always chooses 'lying cheats' as boyfriends.

In April 2018, she wrote on her Facebook page: 'Just always seem to choose cheating pathological liars... I just choose lying cheats, it’s a skill.'
